label: thm-fitness-potential-mean-square-continuity
label_text: Mean-Square Continuity of the Fitness Potential Operator
full_statement_text: Let $\mathcal{S}_1$ and $\mathcal{S}_2$ be two swarm states. Let $\mathbf{V}_1$ and $\mathbf{V}_2$ be the corresponding N-dimensional fitness potential vectors, generated from the full stochastic measurement and potential calculation pipeline. The Fitness Potential Operator is mean-square continuous. The expected squared Euclidean distance between the fitness potential vectors is bounded by a deterministic function of the input swarm states: $\mathbb{E}[\|\mathbf{V}_1 - \mathbf{V}_2\|_2^2] \le F_{\text{pot}}(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2)$ where the **Expected Squared Potential Error Bound**, $F_{\text{pot}}$, is defined as: $F_{\text{pot}}(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2) := E_{\text{unstable,ms}}^2(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2) + E_{\text{stable,ms}}^2(\mathcal{S}_1, \mathcal{S}_2)$ and the two error components are the expected squared errors from the unstable and stable sets of walkers, respectively.
